Public Class methods

new(*args)

Initialize new DataTable object accepts either a list of arguments for backward compatability or a hash of options.

If you pass a list of arguments:

  • :table_div_id: DOM element ID for div surrounding table
  • :col_defs: Hash of column definitions
  • :data_rows: Hash of data rows
  • :footer_row: footer div id. -See ActiveWarehouse for the yui_adapter than uses this
  • :options: additional hash of options, including :table_id, the

DOM element ID for the HTML table

If you pass a hash of options: Same as list of options except in an options Hash. Also accepts a :data_keys hash, which, if not supplied is generated automatically from the :col_defs hash

HTML Table Example:

col_defs = [{:label=>"First", :key=>"firstname", :sortable=>true}, {:label=>"Last", :key=>"lastname", :sortable=>true}, {:label=>"Age", :key=>"age", :formatter=>"number", :sortable=>true, :sortOptions=> {:defaultDir=>"YAHOO.widget.DataTable.CLASS_DESC"}}, {:label=>"Description", :key=>"description", :sortable=>false}, {:label=>"Balance", :key=>"balance", :formatter=>"currency", :sortable=>true}]

data_keys = [{:key=>"firstname"}, {:key=>"lastname"}, {:key=>"age", :parser=>"YAHOO.util.DataSource.parseNumber"}, {:key=>"description"}, {:key=>"balance", :parser=>"this.parseNumberFromCurrency"}]

@data_table = Yui4Rails::Widgets::DataTable.new(:table_div_id => "markup", :col_defs => @col_defs, :data_keys => @data_keys, :table_id => ‘yui_table’) In the view: <%= @data_table.render(:source => :html) %>

Public Instance methods

initial_sort(key, dir='asc')

Add initial sort direction. This does not correctly with HTML-based tables, and not implemented yet for json (yeah, so it doesn‘t work) :key: column key to sort by :dir: initial sort direction (default is asc)

paginate(rows = 50)

Add pagination to YUI datatable. ex: @data_table.paginate(5)

  • :rows: number of rows per page
render(options={})

Renders the datatable

  • :options[:source]: the datasource for the datatable

e.g., :json(default) or :html
